did.unittitle: A collection of poems sayters and lampoones

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: For provenance information, consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Osborn fb140 is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: A Collection of Poems Sayters and Lampoones. James Marshall and Marie-Louise Osborn Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from a previously existing list or card set. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained; the volume may contain additional unlisted material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The following finding aid is a partial inventory of the contents of Osborn fb140. This list was reformatted from previously existing cataloging.

did.unittitle: "The Duke of Buckingham's Entertainment at the Court of France when the King gave him his Sword and the Belt besett with Diamonds".

p. 100
Anonymous manuscript.
Buckingham, George Villiers, 2nd
Duke of, 1628-87. Louis XIV, King of
France, 1638-1715.

did.unittitle: "On Thursday the Twenty ninth day of May is to be sold at Publique Sale today by Inch of Candle att the Royall house neer Chairing Crosse these following goods in Several parcells".

p. 162.
Anonymous manuscript.

court of Charles II.
